definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.chinese: 基于几个排印上的原因。

sentences.english: Two blocks are considered joint, if they concern each other by hanging indents .
sentences.chinese: 两座正在考虑联合，如果他们担心对方挂排印。

sentences.english: The money, whose total amount has yet to be announced, is intended to help the journals improve their editorial and print quality.
sentences.chinese: 这些经费将用来帮助学术期刊改善编辑和排印质量。

sentences.english: The head-words in this dictionary are printed in bold type.
sentences.chinese: 这部词典的词目是用黑体字排印的。

sentences.english: Typography is one of the most prominent elements in my designs.
sentences.chinese: 字体排印是我的设计中最重要一个元素。
明显的排印错误已经纠正。

sentences.english: From time to time stock errors or typographical mistakes may occur.
sentences.chinese: 不时股票错误或排印错误可能发生。

definition: to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to go to press/to submit for printing
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
